headline.main: World Briefing | Europe: Macedonia: War Crimes Investigation

lead_paragraph: The United Nations war crimes tribunal is investigating whether war crimes were committed in Macedonia by government troops and ethnic Albanian rebels, the court's chief prosecutor, Carla Del Ponte, said during a visit to the country. The National Liberation Army mounted an insurgency earlier this year that threatened to turn into into civil war but it surrendered many of its weapons to NATO troops in September under a peace plan that included a pledge of amnesty. Parliament approved a new constitution last week that broadens rights for the ethnic Albanian minority as called for under the peace plan.
